column4: hi, I am trying to locate a free program for windows that will allow me to write the ubuntu netbook edition to a SD card. I do not have a USB drive right now... I cannot seem to find any solutions via google
have you tried using alive disk? and installing it that way?
never heard of alive disk... will try netbootin first
a live disk (ubuntu sio3;2~)
a live disk (ubuntu iso)*
how do you get all the updates without the internet?
you can install without the internet using a live disk?
that sounds pretty convoluted, is the camera set to the right set up for being used as a card
can you write to the file just using windows?
how do i make the sd card bootable then?
ermm...use a normal adapter and not a camera might help
im going to extract the iso to the sd's main directory
well that might work, but i dunno if the camera ill let you boot from the card
i thought more, burn the disk and install to the ssd card
not booting from the camera... booting directly in netbook from the netbook's sd slot
well use slot now?
eitherway install ubuntu onto the drive rather than unloadiung the iso onto it, you will have to set the bootable bit etc
so why were you using the camera when you have a sd slot?
i don't have an sd adapter on my windows computer
i only have my camera as an adapter for windows. my netbook has a sd slot
what is on your netbook atm?
OS wise?
